body:
I can't say if this is AI or not, but it looks like indeed this these commands haven't been tested.

`?` is an interactive command available in the interactive prompt of gdisk, but not an actual command-line argument. For example, you could do:

`sudo gdisk /path/to/device`

Which launches gdisk, which you can then do `?` on its own for help in the gdisk prompt.

However, there is no argument called `?`, you can't do `-?` in the command-line arguments before launching gdisk afaik.

body:
Hi @sebastiaanspeck,

Thanks for the review! I'm happy to make this change, but I just wanted to ask for a quick clarification on the style guideline, as I'm now seeing conflicting standards from reviewers.

On my previous (merged) PR **#19129** for `bun-install`, I was specifically asked by @Managor and @znarfm to *use* the `{{[i|install]}}` syntax for every single example (which I originally had not done). You can see those review comments in that PR's log.

Your suggestion here (using the simple `command` + a `> Note:`) is how I *first* tried to do it, but I was corrected on that last PR.

I just want to make sure I'm following the project's final consensus. Could you, @Managor, and @znarfm please advise on the definitive style?

1.  Should I use the `{{[alias|command]}}` syntax in every example (like `bun-install` )?
2.  Or should I use the simple `command` + `> Note:` style (as you suggested here)?

I'll wait for your decision before pushing any changes. Thanks to all of you for the guidance!

```sh
  • Automatically starts a hot-reloading dev server
  • Auto-detects & configures TailwindCSS and shadcn/ui

  bun create <MyReactComponent.(jsx|tsx)>

Templates:
  • NPM: Runs bunx create-<template> with given arguments
  • GitHub: Downloads repository contents as template
  • Local: Uses templates from $HOME/.bun-create/<name> or ./.bun-create/<name>

Learn more: https://bun.com/docs/cli/bun-create
```
